Description: Necropolis de Thèbes, one of three studies for Plate 42 of the artist's 'Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte, pendant les campagnes du Général Bonaparte', 1802; view of a hillside with rows of rock tombs Pen and grey ink, with grey wash
Producer name: Drawn by: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Curator's comments: Engraved by Berthault. There are no drawings relating to the two ground plans of this plate. There is no copy of Denon's 'Voyage...' in the Department. The B.L. copy is at 458.h.12. The minutes of the Trustees' meeting on 12th December, 1835, record that "two or three" of the drawings were missing when the group was offered to the Museum.
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Associated places: Topographic representation of: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt)
Associated titles: Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte
